guides.title: Setting up synced Dropbox Folders
guides.abstract: This guide will walk you through setting up a shared folder in Dropbox and adding it to your refurence for syncing images

steps.body: Create a Dropbox account
Create a folder to host your images
Put images in the folder and sync
Get the folder URL and copy-it (Ctrl-C)
Go to your refurence page and enter Edit mode
Select the gallery you want to display the images
Click the 'folder' button and paste the previously copied URL into the text box.  Now click Submit
Reload the page and your images will be show up in the gallery.  This will be refreshed everytime your refurence is viewed
Now you can just copy images to you Dropbox folder and they will automatically sync to your refurence.  This makes it really handy to update your images :D

guides.title: Setting up synced GoogleDrive Folders
guides.abstract: This guide will walk you through setting up a shared folder in GoogleDrive and adding it to your refurence for syncing images

steps.body: Create a GoogleDrive
Create a folder to host your images
Put images in the folder and sync
Set the folder's sharing settings to Public: Everyone with a link can see
Open the hosted drive in a new tab/window
Get the folder URL and copy-it (Ctrl-C)
Go to your refurence page and enter Edit mode
Select the gallery you want to display the images
Click the 'folder' button and paste the previously copied URL into the text box.  Click Submit
Reload the page and your images will be show up in the gallery.  This will be refreshed everytime your refurence is viewed
Now you can just copy images to you GoogleDrive folder and they will automatically sync to your refurence.  This makes it really handy to update your images :D

guides.title: Creating and Editing ImageLinks
guides.abstract: This guide will show you how to create a cool-looking ImageLink for URLs to different sites, email, or general flair.  When an ImageLink is clicked in the browser it will open the URL it is pointing to.  In HTML it is an <a> element

steps.body: Go to your refurence page and enter Edit mode
Click the + icon to add an ImageLink
An ImageLink is added
Click the new ImageLink icon to edit it.  Change the icon by pasting a URL in the icon field and clicking submit
You can edit the URL the ImageLink will open when clicked by pasting a URL into the link field and clicking submit
Here is the final product on the refurence.  When a user clicks the wolf icon, they will be redirected to Google
If you want to remove an ImageLink, go to Edit mode press the ImageLink - button
